Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: The shooter who attempted to assassinate Donald Trump was “Maxwell Yearick.”
Matched Articles.Justification: The FBI identified the shooter at the July 13 Donald Trump rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, as Thomas Matthew Crooks, a 20-year-old from Bethel Park, Pennsylvania. The gun used in the assassination attempt was traced to Crooks’ father. The FBI believes Crooks acted alone.
Sources: FBI Statement on Incident in Butler

source_claims.claim: The shooter who attempted to assassinate Donald Trump was “Maxwell Yearick.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Footage shows explosion on Baltimore bridge.
Matched Articles.Justification: The explosion shown in this footage is from 2022 and happened on Kerch Bridge, which connects Crimea and Russia. Learn more about PolitiFact’sfact-checking process and rating system.

source_claims.claim: Footage shows explosion on Baltimore bridge.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: The 2020 election was the only time in American history that an election took more than 24 hours to count.
Matched Articles.Justification: There has never been a presidential election in which every vote has been counted within 24 hours. Official results take days to weeks to certify, experts said. Media organizations can call races before every vote is counted. There are several examples of presidential and state elections that took longer than the 2020 presidential election to call. Learn more about PolitiFact’sfact-checking process and rating system.

source_claims.claim: The 2020 election was the only time in American history that an election took more than 24 hours to count.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Cloud seeding program connected to recent California storms.
Matched Articles.Justification: A four-year cloud seeding pilot program in California began in November. It targeted four mountain regions to increase precipitation during storms. Its ultimate goal is increasing the region’s water supply. No cloud seeding took place during a recent storm that left about 37 million people under flood alerts, a program spokesperson said. The cloud seeding pilot has safety mechanisms to avoid seeding during dangerous conditions and does not seed large storms such as this. Learn more about PolitiFact’sfact-checking process and rating system.

source_claims.claim: Cloud seeding program connected to recent California storms.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Benjamin Netanyahu refused to take a microphone from an Arab official, suggesting his belief that Arabs “are unclean.”
Matched Articles.Justification: A video that showed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asking for hand sanitizer before touching a microphone a United Arab Emirates official handed him took place during the COVID-19 pandemic’s apex. Netanyahu had for months urged Israelis to take preventive measures, such as hand-washing. Netanhayu has on several occasions shaken hands with Arab leaders without requesting hand sanitizer. In 2019, he accepted a microphone from Yemen’s foreign minister when his own did not work. Learn more about PolitiFact’sfact-checking process and rating system.

source_claims.claim: Benjamin Netanyahu refused to take a microphone from an Arab official, suggesting his belief that Arabs “are unclean.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows Israeli soldiers “raising their flag” over al-Shifa hospital in Gaza.
Matched Articles.Justification: The video was not taken in al-Shifa hospital, but at a nearby building. A journalist using satellite imagery to find where the video was shot found that it showed the Gaza Preliminary School for Boys. We verified the location by using Google Earth imagery and identifying matching features from the video. ​

source_claims.claim: Video shows Israeli soldiers “raising their flag” over al-Shifa hospital in Gaza.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: "Acapulco destroyed by yet another directed weather attack!”
Matched Articles.Justification: Hurricane Otis stunned weather forecasters with winds that rapidly intensified in the 24 hours before it struck Acapulco, a Mexican resort city. Such rapid intensification is becoming more common because of warming oceans, a recent study showed. There are weather modification programs in use, but none that could intensify a hurricane or direct it on a path, experts said.
Sources: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

source_claims.claim: "Acapulco destroyed by yet another directed weather attack!”

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: The U.S. chicken and egg shortage is linked to Bill Gates.
Matched Articles.Justification: The Agriculture Department has said the avian flu outbreak in the U.S. is the main contributor to low inventory and high prices. Other factors are pandemic-related supply chain issues and holiday demand. Over the last decade, Bill Gates has invested in multiple companies, including Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods, that develop plant-based meat alternatives. He has also been a proponent of chicken farming. Since 2020, Gates has held the title of the nation’s largest private farmland owner, per The Land Report. As of 2022, he owned 248,000 acres of farmland across more than a dozen states, but this accounts for less than 1% of the total farmland in the U.S.
Sources: Various searches on Google and Nexis

source_claims.claim: The U.S. chicken and egg shortage is linked to Bill Gates.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: A fake Nancy Pelosi said she won’t seek the speaker position again because the real Pelosi was arrested in 2021.

source_claims.claim: A fake Nancy Pelosi said she won’t seek the speaker position again because the real Pelosi was arrested in 2021.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: “It’s not that there is no evidence the election was stolen, but that no court had the guts to HEAR the evidence. They dismissed the cases, NOT the evidence.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Election security officials have said the 2020 presidential election was secure and post-election audits in various states found no evidence of widespread fraud. Post-election lawsuits were thrown out for jurisdictional or procedural reasons, but several judges also said the Trump campaign’s allegations of election fraud lacked sufficient proof. A group of prominent conservatives examined 64 cases brought by Trump and his allies and found that 30 included a hearing on the case’s merits. Trump and his allies won only one case, and it involved too few votes to impact the results, the group found.

source_claims.claim: “It’s not that there is no evidence the election was stolen, but that no court had the guts to HEAR the evidence. They dismissed the cases, NOT the evidence.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: There’s a “coincidental correlation” between COVID-19 vaccines and a spike in cancer in adults younger than 50.
Matched Articles.Justification: A recent study showed an increase in early onset cancer — cases diagnosed in adults ages 20 to 49. The data analyzed in the study was collected from 2000 to 2012 from 44 countries, involving 14 types of cancers. COVID-19 vaccines, which rolled out in early 2021, do not cause cancer, health experts say.

source_claims.claim: There’s a “coincidental correlation” between COVID-19 vaccines and a spike in cancer in adults younger than 50.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows “Italians take down an EU flag and replace it with an Italian flag” after the 2022 national election.
Matched Articles.Justification: The video is from 2013 and features neo-fascists in Italy tearing down the European Union flag. It is unrelated to the 2022 Italian election.

source_claims.claim: Video shows “Italians take down an EU flag and replace it with an Italian flag” after the 2022 national election.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: CNN tweeted about “brave children” in Ukraine signing up to fight Russia.
Matched Articles.Justification: •The tweet was fabricated and did not originate with CNN.

source_claims.claim: CNN tweeted about “brave children” in Ukraine signing up to fight Russia.

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: "Twitter has suspended the account of Afghanistan’s elected President… and have allowed the Taliban to keep their accounts."
Matched Articles.Justification: Twitter hasn’t suspended Afghanistan’s president. Two other accounts associated with the government are suspended as Twitter awaits identity verification from them. The Taliban is allowed on Twitter so long as they don’t break the platform’s rules, and so far, they have been careful not to.

source_claims.claim: "Twitter has suspended the account of Afghanistan’s elected President… and have allowed the Taliban to keep their accounts."

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris “continuously questioned the vaccine during the campaign” but now “they support vaccine cards and forced vaccinations.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Biden and Harris questioned whether Trump would roll out COVID-19 vaccines safely. They did not question the vaccines themselves. The Biden administration supports requiring some people, such as members of the military and VA hospital workers, to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

source_claims.claim: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris “continuously questioned the vaccine during the campaign” but now “they support vaccine cards and forced vaccinations.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: instagram-posts
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Says the defense secretary texted all active military personnel saying they needed to get vaccinated by the following morning or “be court martialed.”
Matched Articles.Justification: There’s no evidence to support this claim. The Defense Department has said it’s not true, and it originated on a website that has previously published baseless claims.

source_claims.claim: Says the defense secretary texted all active military personnel saying they needed to get vaccinated by the following morning or “be court martialed.”
